publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-491 Marilyn Livingstone: Adam Smith College—That the Parliament congratulates Adam Smith College on its excellent HM Inspectorate of Education report, published on 7 September 2007; notes that the report commends Adam Smith College for its sector-leading and innovative practice in nine service areas, a figure only achieved by a handful of colleges in the past, for its good knowledge of social and economic factors in Fife, for its committed and enthusiastic staff, placing a high importance on the effectiveness of the learning and teaching process, and considers that the report is a great testament to Adam Smith College staff, Dr Craig Thomson and his management team who have contributed to the further enhancement of an already excellent learning experience and increased substantially social mobility and the growth of the local and Scottish economy.

S3M-491 Adam Smith College (lodged on 18 September 2007) Jackie Baillie*, John Park*, Trish Godman*, Karen Whitefield*, Mary Mulligan*, Murdo Fraser*, Jim Tolson*, Iain Gray*, Bill Kidd*, Patricia Ferguson*, Claire Baker*, David Whitton*, Elaine Murray*
S3M-491 Adam Smith College (lodged on 18 September 2007) Ken Macintosh*, Malcolm Chisholm*

S3M-491 Marilyn Livingstone: Adam Smith College—That the Parliament congratulates Adam Smith College on its excellent HM Inspectorate of Education report, published on 7 September 2007; notes that the report commends Adam Smith College for its sector-leading and innovative practice in nine service areas, a figure only achieved by a handful of colleges in the past, for its good knowledge of social and economic factors in Fife, for its committed and enthusiastic staff, placing a high importance on the effectiveness of the learning and teaching process, and considers that the report is a great testament to Adam Smith College staff, Dr Craig Thomson and his management team who have contributed to the further enhancement of an already excellent learning experience and increased substantially social mobility and the growth of the local and Scottish economy. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, John Park, Trish Godman, Karen Whitefield, Mary Mulligan, Murdo Fraser, Jim Tolson, Iain Gray, Bill Kidd, Patricia Ferguson, Claire Baker, David Whitton, Elaine Murray, Ken Macintosh, Malcolm Chisholm, Mary Scanlon*
S3M-491 Adam Smith College (lodged on 18 September 2007) Rhona Brankin*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-491 Adam Smith College (lodged on 18 September 2007) Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-491 Adam Smith College (lodged on 18 September 2007) Rhoda Grant*
